alert.note: Alert for Central Yampa River Basin; Flat Tops (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 4:54PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Garfield and northeastern Rio Blanco Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 454 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles east of Meeker, or 34 miles northwest of Glenwood Springs, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Garfield and northeastern Rio Blanco Counties, including the following locations... Buford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Yampa River Basin; Flat Tops
